The new company holds over 43,500 bitcoins , making it the world's third-largest corporate holder of the cryptocurrency, according to crypto publication The Block. title: There's no Dow or S&P 500 for cryptocurrencies yet. Bitwise is getting a step closer with new ETF - CNBC
content:
The Bitwise 10 Crypto Index ETF (BITW) holds the following 10 digital assets: Bitcoin, ether, XRP, Solana, Chainlink, Litecoin, Cardano, Avalanche, Sui and Polkadot.

This makes BITW the first ETF by a major crypto asset manager to include Cardano, Avalanche, Sui and Polkadot, Bitwise CEO and co-founder Hunter Horsley told CNBC.

The new Bitcoin token is photographed on U.S. $100 bills.

Sopa Images | Lightrocket | Getty Images [...] This move follows the Securities and Exchange Commission's approval of a rash of spot bitcoin ETFs in the U.S. in January 2024. Since then, asset managers have jockeyed for approvals to launch ETFs tracking a wider range of digital assets, from altcoins like sui and aptos to memecoins such as official Trump and dogecoin. [...] The Bitwise 10 Crypto Index ETF (BITW) holds the following 10 digital assets: Bitcoin, ether, XRP, Solana, Chainlink, Litecoin, Cardano, Avalanche, Sui and Polkadot. The conversion makes BITW the first ETF by a major crypto asset manager to include Avalanche, Sui and Polkadot, Bitwise CEO and co-founder Hunter Horsley told CNBC.

title: Drones, Fake Birdsong, and Broken Glass Traps: Malaysia is Undergoing an Unprecedented "Bitcoin Crackdown" - Bitget
content: The Malaysian government is intensifying its crackdown on illegal bitcoin mining, utilizing technologies such as drones and sensors to uncover numerous operations, with electricity theft causing significant losses. In early October this year, when bitcoin prices hit a historic high, authorities had already registered about 3,000 electricity theft cases related to mining. Bitcoin mining is essentially a computing power race: rows of specialized equipment perform trillions of calculations per second, aiming to successfully validate transactions and earn bitcoin rewards. According to a report by the Cambridge Centre for Alternative Finance, currently over 75% of bitcoin mining activities are concentrated in the United States. In Malaysia, as long as operators legally obtain electricity and pay taxes according to the law, bitcoin mining is considered legal. At the first meeting of the special committee on November 25, members discussed whether to recommend a complete ban on bitcoin mining. He further stated that the large number of illegal bitcoin mining sites and the operating patterns of those behind them indicate the presence of organized crime.

title: Residents wage legal battle with bitcoin mining company over controversial plans: 'Rushed the process' - Yahoo
content: # Residents wage legal battle with bitcoin mining company over controversial plans: 'Rushed the process'. Residents in Hood County, Texas, are pushing back against nonstop industrial noise from a nearby bitcoin mining facility — and the company behind it has fired back with a lawsuit. The Fort Worth Star-Telegram reported that, according to the lawsuit, county officials "rushed the process" and urged the county judge to sign it quickly because "time is of the essence." The complaint alleges the county mishandled a petition to incorporate the neighborhood as a new city. The dispute centers on a mining site operated by MARA Holdings in Hood County. Mining cryptocurrency like bitcoin consumes approximately 91 terawatt-hours of electricity per year — that's more than the total energy used by Finland, which is home to over 5 million people, The New York Times reported. The World Economic Forum noted that lawmakers are proposing legislation to regulate cryptocurrency, with some pushing for a moratorium on mining operations that use dirty energy sources.

title: Bitcoin Miners on the Run After Stealing $1.1 Billion in Electricity - Futurism
content: # Bitcoin Miners on the Run After Stealing $1.1 Billion in Electricity. As *Bloomberg* reports, local law enforcement is hunting down about 14,000 illegal Bitcoin mining operations in Malaysia, which they say have stolen around $1.1 billion in electricity over the last five years. Besides causing over a billion dollars in losses for Malaysia’s state-owned energy company Tenaga Nasional, illegal mining operations could wreak havoc on the country’s grid as well. “The risk of allowing such activities to happen is no longer about stealing,” Malaysia’s deputy minister of energy transition and water transformation, Akmal Nasir, who chairs a special task force specifically set up to crack down on illegal Bitcoin mining, told *Bloomberg*. Rolling power outages in Iran last year, for instance, sparked a heated debate over the role of illegal Bitcoin mining. Worldwide, Bitcoin mining operations chew through a gargantuan amount of power, consuming more electricity than an entire country each year.

title: Green Blockchain Consensus: Balancing Energy Efficiency, Security, And Decentralization - Forbes
content: # Green Blockchain Consensus: Balancing Energy Efficiency, Security, And Decentralization. Transitioning to more sustainable consensus mechanisms, however, introduces fundamental trade-offs in security, decentralization, and scalability. The Energy-Security Trade-Off. In **Proof-of-Work (PoW)** systems like Bitcoin, every new block of transactions must be verified before it is added to the chain. Networks use safeguards like slashing and random selection, but PoW remains more battle-tested for security - **a trade-off between energy efficiency and proven resilience**. **Hybrid models** combine PoS with additional security mechanisms to achieve faster transaction confirmation (finality) while keeping energy use low. For green blockchains, the challenge is clear: **how do we make systems efficient without turning them into exclusive clubs?** Alternative consensus models attempt different approaches to this challenge. Networks like Chia already use a hybrid called **Proof-of-Space-and-Time (PoST)**, where farmers allocate disk space and then add a time delay for security. By keeping validator requirements low, Fusaka ensures home stakers can continue participating without needing enterprise-grade infrastructure - exemplifying the careful balance between performance and decentralization that defines sustainable blockchain design.

title: ‘StableChain’ Launch Shows How Far Crypto Has Strayed From Bitcoin’s Original Promise - Gizmodo
content: StableChain, which is a new layer-one blockchain network built around Tether’s USDT stablecoin by a company known as Stable, went live with its mainnet today, alongside the launch of its native STABLE token. The combined market cap of USDC and USDT alone now exceeds $250 billion, and the success of these tokens underscores a broader trend in crypto where asset issuers and fintechs build increasingly proprietary and centralized infrastructure and reject more decentralized base-layer protocols that have less relevance when so much centralization is found at other layers of the crypto technology stack anyway. The idea with Stable is to embrace this reality of stablecoin dominance in crypto by building a blockchain that is purpose-built for these centrally issued, dollar-pegged tokens from the ground up. Due to the longstanding reliance alternative crypto networks like Ethereum have had on stablecoins and other key points of centralization, it’s unclear what their value propositions will be if the likes of Tether, Circle, Coinbase, and other major, centralized players in the crypto space can push users over to their own proprietary platforms.

title: Tronox stock jumps on $600M potential EXIM-EFA financing - Mining.com
content:
Staff Writer | December 9, 2025 | 11:20 am  Critical Minerals Markets News Australia USA Rare Earth

Industrial facility for processing rare earth elements. Stock image.

Tronox Holdings’ (NYSE: TROX) stock surged Tuesday after it announced it received coordinated, conditional letters of support and interest from the Export-Import Bank of the United States (EXIM) and Export Finance Australia (EFA) for potential limited financing of up to $600 million. [...] The financing would support development of the Stamford, Connecticut-based company’s rare earth supply chain, including mine extensions, infrastructure support, and cracking and leaching capacity.

Tronox is also a global producer of titanium products from its mineral sands mines in Australia, South Africa and Brazil. [...] The company said it is advancing a definitive feasibility study for a proposed cracking and leaching facility in Western Australia, aimed at producing mixed rare earth carbonate containing both light and heavy rare earth elements.

Tronox already mines and sells tailings material containing monazite. This financing would see the company capture multiples more value from its supply base, it said.

title: Silver price soars past $60 for new record - Mining.com
content:
Go to MDC Markets [...] Silver notched another record high on Tuesday as the precious metal continues to attract bids amid concerns over a market deficit.

Spot silver rose as much as 3.6% to a new peak of $60.46 per ounce, keeping the momentum of a record-breaking that has lasted several weeks.

Driving the surge was an unprecedented supply crunch after a historic squeeze hit the London market in October. Bloomberg data shows that Chinese inventories are now hovering at their lowest in a decade.

title: Silver Hits $60 For The First Time—Here’s Why Prices Are Outpacing Gold - Forbes
content:
Nearly 109%. That’s how much spot silver has increased this year, outpacing gold, which has surged 60% while setting several milestones. Spot gold has increased just 0.4% over the last day to around $4,226, after hitting an all-time high above $4,381 in October. Spot platinum has also outpaced gold, rallying 86% as demand for electric vehicles has lifted platinum’s value in recent years, while global supply declines.

Got a tip? Share confidential information with Forbes. [...] The latest surge in silver prices comes as traders are pricing in 87% odds of the Federal Reserve lowering interest rates by a quarter-point Wednesday, according to CME’s FedWatch tool, which would cut rates to between 3.5% and 3.75%—an uptick in precious metal prices often coincides with reduced interest rates and a weaker U.S. dollar.

The U.S. dollar index has dropped 8.5% this year, including a 0.5% decline over the last month. [...] Silver prices rose to a record high Tuesday, surpassing the $60 milestone for the first time as the precious metal has outpaced gold this year amid a global supply squeeze and another expected interest rate cut by the Federal Reserve.

title: ASM ‘deepens’ Noveon link as it looks to develop US operations - Australian Mining
content: Australian Strategic Materials (ASM) announced the further sale of 60 tonnes of high-purity neodymium iron boron (NdFeB) alloy to Noveon Magnetics, under its existing 100-tonne supply contract. This support, Smith said, is geared towards Noveon’s production of US-made permanent magnets, which are seen as critical to the development of secure, sovereign supply chains for defence, energy technologies, and electric vehicle applications, among others. In light of the sale, Smith also added that the Korean metals plant’s production continues to ramp up, and that ASM is now fully funded to expand the plant to a production capacity of 3600 tonnes per annum of NdFeB alloy. “The plant is a cornerstone of ASM’s mine to metals strategy to provide solutions for critical materials, from resource to refined product,” Smith said. The company said it is looking forward to continuing its partnership with Noveon and expanding its role in the global supply chain for rare earth and critical metal alloys.

title: India’s journey to self-sustenance in the Rare Earth ecosystem - Times of India
content: Although, the restrictions eased out with China allowing export of light rare earths in Aug ‘25, inherent risk of potential supply chain disruptions continue to exist.India also has rich reserves of rare earths estimated at ~7 Mn Tons & is involved in the production of Nd(Neodymium) / Nd-Pr (Neodymium-Praseodymium) Oxides, which is a precursor for the manufacturing of Nd metal.Currently, there is a bottleneck in the midstream & downstream with very limited presence of players involved in the manufacturing of Nd metals & subsequently Neo magnets, due to regulatory hurdles and reliance on low-cost Chinese imports. China’s export unpredictability underscores the urgency for Indian manufacturers and policymakers to accelerate domestic integration, supporting both the EV30@30 goal (30% EV penetration by 2030) and “China+1” strategy to reduce supply chain risk and maximize upstream potential.Currently, ~100% of India’s rare earth magnet demand is fulfilled through imports.

title: Morningstar starts coverage on Australia's Lynas, sees shares overpriced - TradingView
content: # Morningstar starts coverage on Australia's Lynas, sees shares overpriced. RefinitivLess than 1 min read. \*\* Morningstar kicks off coverage on Lynas LYC, world's top rare-earths producer outside China, pegging fair value estimate at A$7. \*\* Projects EBITDA to surge to a 5-year CAGR of 65%, fuelled by rising sales and firmer prices of rare earth neodymium-praseodymium (NdPr), vital to magnets that power EVs, with volumes expected to double to ~12,500 metric tons by FY30. \*\* However, flags that shares look overpriced despite robust growth prospects, with market baking in lofty rare-earth assumptions; hitting the current share price would require midcycle NdPr price tag of ~$220/kg, more than double Morningstar's view of $100/kg. \*\* Stock has more than doubled in value this year, surging 119.9%. title: USA Rare Earth Subsidiary LCM Partners with Arnold Magnetic Technologies to Secure Rare Earth Metals Supply - The Manila Times
content: USA Rare Earth Subsidiary LCM Partners with Arnold Magnetic Technologies to Secure Rare Earth Metals Supply. # USA Rare Earth Subsidiary LCM Partners with Arnold Magnetic Technologies to Secure Rare Earth Metals Supply. Leveraging LCM’s metal and alloy making expertise, the agreement will ensure a reliable, ex-China source of high-quality rare-earth materials for Arnold’s production of advanced permanent magnets. "LCM’s role demonstrates the strategic importance of secure, reliable sourcing, and how collaboration between trusted partners can guarantee sustainable access to critical rare-earth materials for global magnet manufacturers.”. (Nasdaq: USAR) is developing a rare earth sintered neo magnet (NdFeB or neo) manufacturing plant in Stillwater, Oklahoma, and intends to establish domestic rare earth and critical minerals supply, extraction, and processing capabilities to both supply its magnet manufacturing plant and market surplus materials to third parties. USAR's focus on developing domestic rare earth production aligns with national priorities, offering the potential of a sustainable and secure domestic supply of materials critical to key industries.

title: Congo miners urge urgent talks to clear cobalt export backlog - KITCO
content: Congo’s mining lobby has called for urgent talks with the government to clarify new cobalt export rules, and said that legal ambiguities and compliance hurdles could delay shipments and disrupt global battery supply chains. In the letter to the mines minister dated December 5 and seen by Reuters, the Chamber of Mines said exporters face “serious difficulties” in applying quotas and have repeatedly sought, without success, a meeting with ARECOMS to clarify concerns over its role, the legality of mandatory prepayments, and new documentation requirements that have stalled shipments. China, which controls about 70–75% of global cobalt refining capacity and supplies major companies, including automakers Tesla and BYD and battery maker CATL, depends on Congo for feedstock, making any export delay a threat to EV and battery supply chains. China is unlikely to see cobalt shipments from Congo’s new export quota before April, a veteran Chinese analyst said, citing slow local government procedures and poor road infrastructure hampering transport.

title: China Trade Surplus Tops $1 Trillion On Non-US Growth - Marine Link
content: China's trade surplus topped $1 trillion for the first time as manufacturers seeking to avoid President Donald Trump's tariffs shipped more to non-U.S. markets in November, with exports to Europe, Australia and Southeast Asia surging. "The tariff cuts agreed under the U.S.-China trade truce didn't help to lift shipments to the U.S. last month, but overall export growth rebounded nonetheless," said Zichun Huang, China economist at Capital Economics. China has stepped up efforts to diversify its export markets since Trump won November 2024's U.S. election, pursuing closer trade ties with Southeast Asia and the European Union. October's unexpected downturn, following an 8.3% surge the month prior, signalled that Chinese exporters' tactic of front-loading U.S.-bound shipments to beat Trump's tariffs had run its course. Although Chinese factory owners reported an improvement in new export orders in November, they were still in contraction, underscoring continued uncertainty for manufacturers as they struggle to replace demand in the absence of U.S. buyers.

title: Indigenous land defenders opposed to Canadian company mining for lithium in Nevada are surveilled by the FBI - Peace Brigades International-Canada

On October 1, 2025, CBC News reported: “The U.S. government is taking a minority stake in Lithium Americas, a company that is developing one of the world’s largest lithium mines in northern Nevada. Earlier this year, in February 2025, Human Rights Watch and the American Civil Liberties Union (ACLU) published *this report* that concluded the U.S. government’s decision to permit Lithium Americas to mine at Thacker Pass violated Indigenous people’s rights. An FBI joint terrorism task force in Reno met in June 2022 ‘with a focus on Thacker Pass,’ the records also show, and Lithium Americas — the main company behind the mine — hired a former FBI agent specializing in counterterrorism to develop its security plan.”.

title: Tesla Makes Top 10 In ‘Consumer Reports’ 2026 Automotive Brand Ranking - Forbes
content: # Tesla Makes Top 10 In ‘Consumer Reports’ 2026 Automotive Brand Ranking. Tesla is the only electric vehicle company to make the top 10 in the Consumer Reports 2026 automotive brand report card, which was released Thursday. Tesla came in tenth place with an overall score of 72 from the consumer advocacy organization. The rankings use overall score and safety ratings for each vehicle in the brand’s lineup. The overall score takes into account the group’s road-test scores along with reliability and owner satisfaction data. Tesla tied with Mini and Kia for overall score. In terms of reliability, Tesla ranked ninth with a score of 50 while the only other all-electric company in the mix, Rivian, was dead last with 24. For the CR 2025 report card, Tesla ranked 18th with a 36 reliability score. Seven of the 10 least reliable cars are either plug-in hybrids or EVs. But Tesla is a bright spot in EV reliability: the Model Y is the most reliable EV.

title: Tesla drivers can now turn to Grok for directions - Business Insider
content: # Tesla drivers can now let Grok navigate and be their 'personal guide' on the road. * Tesla says Grok can now add navigation destinations thanks to a new update. * Elon Musk's chatbot was integrated into Tesla vehicles in the summer. Tesla unveiled its 2025 holiday update over the weekend, and the company said Elon Musk's AI chatbot can now add and edit navigation destinations. Grok was first integrated into Tesla vehicles in July. The new feature, which the automaker said would turn Grok into "your personal guide," is the latest sign of the increasingly close integration between Tesla's vehicles and Musk's AI chatbot. Musk announced that Grok would be coming to Tesla EVs in July, shortly after the AI model went on an antisemitic rant on X in which it praised Adolf Hitler. Tesla and xAI did not immediately respond to a request for comment from Business Insider. Grok is only available on certain Tesla vehicles with sufficiently powerful processors.

title: Tesla Zooms Up Reliability Rankings: Consumer Reports Crowns Model 3 and Model Y Champs - OpenTools
content: # Tesla Zooms Up Reliability Rankings: Consumer Reports Crowns Model 3 and Model Y Champs. These models have been instrumental in reshaping Tesla's reputation, with the Model 3 now recognized as the most reliable electric car and the Model Y as the most reliable electric SUV according to the latest data from Consumer Reports source. Tesla's Model 3 and Model Y have firmly established themselves as leaders in reliability within the electric vehicle segment, according to the latest findings from Consumer Reports. While Tesla's reliability rankings have improved, addressing recalls and safety concerns remains a continuous effort for the company. Tesla's rise in the Consumer Reports' reliability rankings showcases how integrating state-of-the-art technology with traditional manufacturing can lead to significant improvements in product reliability. Tesla's significant rise in Consumer Reports' reliability rankings underscores its improving long-term market position. The recognition of Tesla’s Model 3 and Model Y as the most reliable electric car and SUV respectively by Consumer Reports signifies how regulatory compliance can translate into competitive advantages.

title: Tesla Breaks Into Consumer Reports Top 10 Reliability: Model Standouts And Why It Improved - EVWORLD.COM
content: ## Tesla Breaks Into Consumer Reports Top 10 Reliability: Model Standouts And Why It Improved. Tesla is ranked 9th out of 26 brands in Consumer Reports' latest reliability report, a notable rise from 17th last year and near the bottom just a few years ago. * **Fewer new problems:** Stability in hardware reduces variability and improves year-over-year reliability scores. | Model Y | Improving steadily | Strong drivetrain reliability; incremental refinements to fit and software |. | Model S | Mature platform | Long-running design reduces new-problem risk; contributes to brand's overall score |. * **Reliability supports adoption:** Stronger brand performance can accelerate consumer EV uptake. Consumer Reports' latest rankings mark a turning point for Tesla: from inconsistent to competitive on reliability. For buyers, this means Tesla is increasingly a safe bet among EVs, with the usual caveat to choose models with proven track records and local service support. * Tesla Breaks Into Consumer Reports Top 10 Reliability: Model Standouts And Why It Improved.

title: It’s 2028 or break for California’s EV rules - Politico
content: The timeline highlights a harsh reality for climate advocates: State officials have had little answer to Republicans’ assault on California’s nation-leading vehicle emissions standards during President **Donald Trump**’s second term. Trump revoked the state’s electric vehicle sales mandates for cars and heavy-duty trucks in June, quickly following through on his Day 1 executive order to stymie California’s regulatory authority. **RATIOED:** California utilities scored a major victory Wednesday to the dismay of affordability advocates, with regulators stripping a key element energy companies disliked from a proposed power line undergrounding program. “I hate to say it, I’m a Colorado guy, don’t get me wrong, but California — they’ve kind of paved the road for other states to follow on policy, on incentives,” said Colorado Rep. — Interior Secretary **Doug Burgum** predicted that California electric prices are too high to attract data centers — and called the state’s **reliance on foreign oil** a “national security risk.”.

title: Fuel economy rollback - Northern Public Radio
content: The Trump administration has already defanged the existing CAFE standards by eliminating the fines associated with them, as part of the One Big Beautiful Bill Act. Under Former President Joe Biden, the rules called for vehicles to get 2% more efficient every year; the Trump administration is now proposing to revert to the 2022 baseline and increase by .5% annually. Meanwhile, during the second Trump presidency Congress has also eliminated the consumer tax credit for purchasing electric vehicles, decided to end a tax credit for installing an EV charger in June 2026, earlier than planned, and voted to strike down federal waivers that let California require automakers to build zero-emission vehicles. Trump campaigned against what he called the "electric vehicle mandate," and promised to rescind policies — including fuel economy standards — that encouraged or incentivized EVs. Trump has framed the policy rollback as a gift to the auto industry.

content: The Trump administration has already defanged the existing CAFE standards by eliminating the fines associated with them, as part of the One Big Beautiful Bill Act. Meanwhile, during the second Trump presidency Congress has also eliminated the consumer tax credit for purchasing electric vehicles, decided to end a tax credit for installing an EV charger in June 2026, earlier than planned, and voted to strike down federal waivers that let California require automakers to build zero-emission vehicles. Trump campaigned against what he called the "electric vehicle mandate," and promised to rescind policies — including fuel economy standards — that encouraged or incentivized EVs. Trump has framed the policy rollback as a gift to the auto industry.

title: Tesla 'Full Self Driving' Blew Me Away. I Still Wouldn't Buy It - InsideEVs
content: Photo by:  Mack Hogan/InsideEVs. This November, I rented a Tesla Model Y and drove it for about 150 miles, depending on your personal definition of “driving.” For about 145 of those miles, I let Tesla’s “Full Self Driving (Supervised)” control the Model Y, only intervening to park or, occasionally, for fun. In the eight years since I first reviewed it, Tesla’s flagship driver-assistance system has become “Full Self Driving (Supervised)," gaining the capability to handle basically every form of driving under a watchful human eye, not just divided highways. Tesla says its systems are not legally driving, and that owners are responsible for supervising the car at all times. Snap out of it and start driving!” Because of this, I never trusted Tesla Autopilot. Tesla repeatedly says that FSD is a driver assistance system, and is never legally driving the car. If the car crashes based on its own inputs, Tesla says you were still “driving,” and it’s still going to be your problem.

title: Elon Musk says Tesla drivers can text while driving, but they absolutely should not - The Verge
content: # Elon Musk says Tesla drivers can text while driving, but they absolutely should not. I can’t believe I have to say this, but Tesla drivers should not start texting while driving, despite what Elon Musk says. Musk took a break from posting racist and xenophobic screeds yesterday to confirm that the latest version of Tesla’s Full Self-Driving software would allow for some instances of texting while driving, despite it being incredibly unsafe and illegal in 49 states, Washington, DC, and the US territories. For months now, Musk has been promising an “unsupervised” version of Tesla’s Full Self-Driving software that he claims will enable drivers to, among other things, use their phones while driving. (In other words, not full self-driving.) For years, Musk has been hyping a moment when Tesla’s vehicles will actually drive themselves — no supervision required. Last month, at Tesla’s annual shareholder meeting, Musk said that an upcoming FSD update, Version 14, would finally allow for unsupervised driving.
